title: Virginia Uses Treated Wastewater to Shore Up a Drinking Water Aquifer
description: A crucial aquifer is running low, so officials are pumping in treated sewage. Itâ€™s an increasingly common strategy as heavy demand and climate change strain water supplies.
dc:creator: Elena Shao
media:credit: Kristen Zeis for The New York Times
media:description: A sediment sample taken this week in Newport News, Va. A planned recharge well at the site will inject additional treated wastewater into the Potomac Aquifer.
